TopicTitle: Help me out here, need space games

Articles.Content:
Hey guys,

Every couple of months/years I get a craving to play garish space games. It's that time again and I need me some gratuitous, mainstreamy space battles and explosions. Think something along the lines of Nexus: The jupiter incident or a more hands on space/fighter/sim like the X series. I'm currently playing Endless Space, a fairly good if somewhat bland 4x game. I've seen something-something-pegasus, but it didn't appeal. Any tips for me? Something new-ish (released 2010 on) I want most, but some oldies I might've missed are welcome too. Bring on the suggestions, tell me your favourite 'not too much thought required' space games!
Space Rangers 2 would be one of my picks, I love that game, or FTL, or any number of old abandonware games

Freelancer is a good one, if you can get a copy of it. check Amazon, that's where I got my copy, and it definitely runs on Windows XP, not sure if it runs on Windows 7 yet, as I have not tried that yet (still have my old winXP install ready-to-go on an ancient 40gb PATA HDD for backwards-compatibility)

EDIT: Another one is DarkStar One, its quite similar to Freelancer and its available on Steam

Edited September 19, 2012 by SciMan

Both Independence War games are very good, capital ship combat and available on GOG.

Edited September 19, 2012 by sal_vager
Yeah I loved freelancer. Had some good moments in it. Thanks for your suggestions, keep em coming!
I've heard of Kinetic Void, like KSP with guns and battleships.

X2: The Threat is a good one, but X3: Terran Conflict is better if you want to fly around in the Solar system, although the Orbital Mechanics are non-existent, it's just point in direction and keep engines on max throttle
